name: pd.read_csv()
describe: Reads a CSV file into a DataFrame.

name: pd.read_excel()
describe: Reads an Excel file into a DataFrame.

name: pd.DataFrame()
describe: Creates a new DataFrame.

name: df.head()
describe: Returns the first few rows of the DataFrame.

name: df.tail()
describe: Returns the last few rows of the DataFrame.

name: df.info()
describe: Displays a concise summary of the DataFrame.

name: df.describe()
describe: Computes descriptive statistics of the numerical columns in the DataFrame.

name: df.shape
describe: Returns the number of rows and columns in the DataFrame.

name: df.columns
describe: Returns the column labels of the DataFrame.

name: df.index
describe: Returns the index of the DataFrame.

name: df.dtypes
describe: Returns the data types of each column in the DataFrame.

name: df.values
describe: Converts the DataFrame to a NumPy array.

name: df.loc[]
describe: Selects data based on labels.

name: df.iloc[]
describe: Selects data based on integer positions.

name: df.at[]
describe: Accesses a single value by label.

name: df.iat[]
describe: Accesses a single value by integer position.

name: df.set_index()
describe: Sets one or more columns as the DataFrame's index.

name: df.reset_index()
describe: Resets the index to the default integer index.

name: df.sort_values()
describe: Sorts the DataFrame by specified column(s).

name: df.sort_index()
describe: Sorts the DataFrame by the index.

name: df.isnull()
describe: Returns a boolean DataFrame indicating whether each element is a null value.

name: df.notnull()
describe: Returns a boolean DataFrame indicating whether each element is not a null value.

name: df.dropna()
describe: Removes rows or columns containing null values.

name: df.fillna()
describe: Fills null values in the DataFrame.

name: df.drop()
describe: Removes specified rows or columns.

name: df.drop_duplicates()
describe: Removes duplicate rows.

name: df.rename()
describe: Renames columns or index labels of the DataFrame.

name: df.astype()
describe: Converts the data type of columns in the DataFrame.

name: df.pivot_table()
describe: Creates a pivot table.

name: df.melt()
describe: Converts a wide-format DataFrame to a long-format.

name: df.merge()
describe: Merges two DataFrames.

name: df.join()
describe: Joins two DataFrames by index.

name: df.groupby()
describe: Groups the DataFrame by one or more columns.

name: df.agg()
describe: Performs aggregation operations on the DataFrame.

name: df.apply()
describe: Applies a function to the rows or columns of the DataFrame.

name: df.applymap()
describe: Applies a function to each element of the DataFrame.

name: df.copy()
describe: Creates a copy of the DataFrame.

name: df.corr()
describe: Computes the correlation matrix of the DataFrame.

name: df.cov()
describe: Computes the covariance matrix of the DataFrame.

name: df.plot()
describe: Plots the DataFrame as a graph.

name: df.hist()
describe: Plots histograms of the numerical columns in the DataFrame.

name: df.boxplot()
describe: Plots box plots of the DataFrame.

name: df.scatter_matrix()
describe: Plots a scatter matrix of the DataFrame.

name: df.to_csv()
describe: Writes the DataFrame to a CSV file.

name: df.to_excel()
describe: Writes the DataFrame to an Excel file.

name: df.to_sql()
describe: Writes the DataFrame to a SQL database.

name: df.to_json()
describe: Converts the DataFrame to a JSON format.

name: df.to_html()
describe: Converts the DataFrame to an HTML table.

name: df.to_dict()
describe: Converts the DataFrame to a dictionary.

name: df.to_numpy()
describe: Converts the DataFrame to a NumPy array.
